intro: Gnidia acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its woody stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a sharp, pointed tip, giving it its common name. Gnidia acutifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
